results.title: Story of Anyburg, USA
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Clyde Geronimi
results.brief_description: A town over-run with traffic hazards puts the cars on trial in an effort to stamp out road acidents, reckless driving and speeding. Automobile factory workers and highway engineers give evidence. The Defence Lawyer proves that an accident was the result of a speeding man rather than a speeding car. The newspaper headlines scream: “Autos acquitted…people admit guilt!”
results.description: A town over-run with traffic hazards puts the cars on trial in an effort to stamp out road acidents, reckless driving and speeding. results.title: Story of a city
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams, Australian National Film Board and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: The story of Newcastle, New South Wales, in the year of 1945, concentrating extensively on the then, and long-time, principal industries: coal mining, iron and steel, and ship building. Briefly surveys a range of contemporary domestic architectural styles and recreational choices of the time (the beach and the race track).

results.title: Story of a book
results.brief_description: This program follows author Holling C. Holling through the process of creating “Pagoo”, the story of a hermit crab. Relates the steps involved in writing a book: the birth of an idea, doing the research, writing and rewriting, illustrating and printing. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Story in the rocks
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra, Marten Toonder Films and Han Van Gelder
results.brief_description: Fossils - the remains of ancient animals and plants preserved in rock strata - reveal little to the uninitiated, but an expert can read a whole history into the skeleton of a fish petrified in rock or reconstruct the appearance of an extinct animal from fragments of bone or even a footprint.

results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dennis Hill Productions
results.brief_description: The origin, formation and beauty of sand is illustrated and the joys of surfing are also shown. Narrated by Stewart Ginn.

results.title: Story behind the tap
results.creator_credit: Richard C. Seeger and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Covers the water supply system of Melbourne from three main catchment areas. Shows water from the catchments supplying storages, then to the suburban distribution reservoirs and finally mains distribution. The various forms of maintenance of the system, purification, and research work on supply problems to an ever-growing city are also presented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard C. Seeger and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works

results.title: Storms on the sun. Part one. Flare - surge events
results.creator_credit: D.G. Perrin and CSIRO. Film Unit
results.brief_description: Disturbances in the solar photosphere and chromosphere. Describes important types of solar phenomena, their growth and appearance on the disk and at the limb. Scientific film suitable for students of physics or astronomy.

results.title: Storms (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This program teaches children about the basic forces of weather. Demonstrations using everyday objects to illustrate rising warm air, falling cool air and the water cycle. Original animation illustrates causes of lightning, thunder and tornadoes, while satellite views of hurricanes show their swirling winds.

results.title: Storm over Asia = Potomok Chingis-Khana
results.brief_description: Set during the British occupation of Mongolia in 1920, this is the half heroic, half ironic story of Bair, a young Mongolian hunter-turned-partisan who is captured. A document in his possession identifies him as a descendent of Genghis Khan. The interventionists decide to ‘resurrect’ him as a puppet king. However Bair escapes and leads the Mongolian army against the interventionists. The intensity of the drama, strong feeling for landscape and dramatic use of montage (four or five times the usual number of shots for a feature of this length) have been compared with the work of D.W. Griffith. In effect, the film is one long chase which takes on mythic proportions while the plot takes on metaphoric and lyrical dimensions (the British army is literally ‘blown away’). The emotional impact disguises the methodological rigour of Pudovkin’s construction. Also known as The Descendant of Genghis Khan. Cast includes Valeri Inkizhinov. This fully restored and digitally remastered version contains an original score by Timothy Brock performed by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.
